summary: Mount St. Helens is a volcano in Washington state, named after a British diplomat. It's part of the Cascade mountain range and the Pacific Ring of Fire. The volcano's famous eruption in 1980 was the deadliest and most destructive in US history, killing 57 people and destroying many homes and roads. The explosion created a huge crater and changed the mountain's height. Despite the dangers, people hike there, and it's now a protected national monument.
title: Mount St. Helens
